established_date4: 12 September 1848 A solemn declaration of the Tagsatzung declared the Federal Constitution adopted on 12 September 1848. A resolution of the ''Tagsatzung'' of 14 September 1848 specified that the powers of the institutions provided for by the 1815 Federal Treaty would expire at the time of the constitution of the Federal Council, which took place on 16 November 1848.

format: dd.mm.yyyy (AD) |drives_on = right |calling_code = +41 |patron_saint = St Nicholas of Flüe |iso3166code = CH |cctld = .ch, .swiss    '''Switzerland''', officially the '''Swiss Confederation''', is a country situated at the confluence of Western, Central, and Southern Europe.   There are several definitions. See Geography of Switzerland#Western or Central Europe?.  It is a federal republic composed of 26 cantons, with federal authorities based in Bern.
